channel.title: Tech how-to, snippets, and collected tech recipes
channel.description: Recent content on Tech how-to, snippets, and collected tech recipes

item.title: Git and GitHub, from scratch
item.description: Creat a Github repository Do this in the Github interface do not “Initialize this repository with a README” Create a Git repository git init git add . git commit -m "first commit" Link the local folder with a Github project git remote add origin https://github.com/github-user/github-project.git git push -u origin master Commit locally, push to Github Do this after changing files git add . git commit -m "commit" git push origin master Create and activate an hotfix branch git branch a_hotfix # create branch git checkout a_hotfix # activate branch (do changes in the branch)

item.title: Hugo and GitHub Pages from scratch, visible sources
item.description: Create a new Github Pages site based on Hugo Creating a new GitHub Pages site based on Hugo, and following this page, assumes A GitHub account exists Hugo is installed Git is installed A DNS tool is available to set the custom domain Create local website cd above-project, and websites> hugo new site workout Add a theme Download the zip from https://github.com/Vimux/mainroad Inside there is a single folder.

item.title: New Java project, Eclipse and GitHub
item.description:

These steps were followed to create a totally new Eclipse project, in sync with GitHub

item.title: A path to learn Java
item.description:
Context

These are the key steps I used to learn Java

item.title: Pattern for Error Handling in Java
item.description:
Principles

  • At high-level, errors are innocuous. Worst case scenario nothing happened and the user can try again.
  • The lowest level will show the stack-dump, not others.
  • TODO: After an error, the upper levels should display their context information in a nicer format. Includes re-create the stack-dump

item.title: Sitemap in Hugo static page generator
item.description: Hugo generates a default sitemap for your site containing all pages and links. Such sitemap can be customized.

item.title: Shortcodes in Hugo static page generator
item.description: Shortcodes are used in .md files. They are a form of customizing the resulting html whenever the .md format does not gives what you need.

item.title: Hugo from scratch on GitHub Pages, hidden sources
item.description:
Instructions to build an Hugo site from scratch, manage it with git, and publish in GitHub Pages. In this scenario only the result files are being uploaded to Github Pages, not the source files.

The source files themselves are also in git. Intentionally the scenario is not publishing those sources publicly in GitHub.
